div.script: components.addItem("unifiedPublishingAlert");

div.span: Everything you need to know regarding schools and the Coronavirus
Find everything from our Remote Learning Plan to how to ask questions using our new Let's Talk feature.

a.title: Read More about Everything you need to know regarding schools and the Coronavirus

a.aria-label: Read More About Expansion of Meal Distribution Sites

div.p: With the success of our meal distribution sites, Citrus Schools is expanding our reach to families by adding meal sites at more schools and now on school bus routes as well.

a.aria-label: Read More About Parents: What questions do you have for us?

div.div: Parents: What questions do you have for us?

a.aria-label: Read More About Proactive Measures against Flu & Coronavirus

div.p: Our district is taking proactive measures to protect our students and staff from illnesses such as the flu and coronavirus.

a.aria-label: Read More About Galaxy of the Stars

div.alt: Jessica Price, Sam Himmel and Althea Council

div.p: Citrus County Schools is proud to announce Jessica Price, a Spanish teacher at Lecanto High School, as Citrus County Schools “Teacher of the Year” for 2021 and Althea Council, a Food Services Manager at Citrus Springs Middle School, as School-Related Employee of the Year for 2020.

a.aria-label: Read More About School Preference Requests Start March 1st

div.p: The Citrus County School District will start processing School Preference Requests for 2020-21 on March 1st.

a.aria-label: Read More About The Phil Royal EMT Program at CRHS

div.div: The Phil Royal EMT Program at CRHS
div.p: A new EMT program offered at Crystal River High School as part of the CRHS Academy of Health Careers is now called The Phil Royal EMT Program.

Our District serves approximately 16,000 students in pre-school through grade 12 across 22 campuses. We are where learning is the expectation and caring is the commitment. We provide exceptional academic, emotional and civic growth to every student, every day. Our passionate educators empower students to take charge of their academic and personal success. The school district spans the cities of Inverness and Crystal River and incorporates communities such as Beverly Hills, Citrus Springs, Floral City, Hernando, Holder, Homosassa, and Lecanto.
Outstanding Start to the New Decade
